intro: Trasis, commonly known as the golden trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a vine or shrub. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Trasis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
